en: Gravestone cross of Albert Davis, Pvt. 521 Engrs. Tennessee, Nov. 14, 1918

Gravestones shaped as crosses in the World War I cemetery in Thiaucourt, France. The gravestone highlighted reads "Albert Davis, Pvt. 521 Engrs. Tennessee, Nov. 14, 1918." The cemetery in Thiaucourt, France commemorates the death of more than 4,000 American military during World War I. The majority of the casualties buried here were involved in the first American battle in the war, which was the successful effort to extricate Germans from the French town near Paris.
Era 7 - The Emergence of Modern America (1890-1930)
